verses.verse: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר <WH1696> way·ḏab·bêr spoke יְהוָ֣ה <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- ... מֹשֶׁ֣ה <WH4872> mō·šeh to Moses בְמִדְבַּר־ <WH4057> ḇə·miḏ·bar- in the Wilderness סִ֠ינַי <WH5514> sî·nay of Sinai: בַּשָּׁנָ֨ה <WH8141> baš·šā·nāh year הַשֵּׁנִ֜ית <WH8145> haš·šê·nîṯ of the second לְצֵאתָ֨ם <WH3318> lə·ṣê·ṯām after [Israel] had come out מֵאֶ֧רֶץ <WH776> mê·’e·reṣ of the land מִצְרַ֛יִם <WH4714> miṣ·ra·yim of Egypt, בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ <WH2320> ba·ḥō·ḏeš month ( The Second Passover) ( 20 12:1-13) הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן 7223 Art│Adj-ms ( hā·ri·šō·wn) In the first לֵאמֹֽר׃ 559 Prep-l│V-Qal-Inf ( lê·mōr) ...

וְיַעֲשׂ֧וּ <WH6213> wə·ya·‘ă·śū are to observe בְנֵי־ <WH1121> ḇə·nê- “ The Israelites יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl ... אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַפָּ֖סַח <WH6453> hap·pā·saḥ the Passover בְּמוֹעֲדֽוֹ׃ <WH4150> bə·mō·w·‘ă·ḏōw at its appointed time.

בְּאַרְבָּעָ֣ה <WH702> bə·’ar·bā·‘āh on the fourteenth עָשָֽׂר־ <WH6240> ‘ā·śār- ... ( Hebrew between the two evenings of the fourteenth; also in verses 5 and 11) י֠וֹם <WH3117> yō·wm day בַּחֹ֨דֶשׁ <WH2320> ba·ḥō·ḏeš month, הַזֶּ֜ה <WH2088> haz·zeh of this בֵּ֧ין <WH996> bên at הָֽעֲרְבַּ֛יִם <WH6153> hå̄·ʿăr·ba·yim twilight תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ <WH6213> ta·‘ă·śū You are to observe אֹת֖וֹ <WH853> ’ō·ṯōw it בְּמוֹעֲד֑וֹ <WH4150> bə·mō·w·‘ă·ḏōw at the appointed time, כְּכָל־ <WH3605> kə·ḵāl- in accordance with חֻקֹּתָ֥יו <WH2708> ḥuq·qō·ṯāw its statutes וּכְכָל־ <WH3605> ū·ḵə·ḵāl- ... מִשְׁפָּטָ֖יו <WH4941> miš·pā·ṭāw and ordinances. ” תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ <WH6213> ta·‘ă·śū - אֹתֽוֹ׃ <WH853> ’ō·ṯōw -

וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר <WH1696> way·ḏab·bêr told מֹשֶׁ֛ה <WH4872> mō·šeh So Moses אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- ... בְּנֵ֥י <WH1121> bə·nê the Israelites יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl ... לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת <WH6213> la·‘ă·śōṯ to observe הַפָּֽסַח׃ <WH6453> hap·pā·saḥ the Passover,

וַיַּעֲשׂ֣וּ <WH6213> way·ya·‘ă·śū and they [did so] אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַפֶּ֡סַח <WH6453> hap·pe·saḥ - בָּרִאשׁ֡וֹן <WH7223> bā·ri·šō·wn of the first בְּאַרְבָּעָה֩ <WH702> bə·’ar·bā·‘āh on the fourteenth עָשָׂ֨ר <WH6240> ‘ā·śār ... י֥וֹם <WH3117> yō·wm day לַחֹ֛דֶשׁ <WH2320> la·ḥō·ḏeš month. בֵּ֥ין <WH996> bên at הָעַרְבַּ֖יִם <WH6153> hā·‘ar·ba·yim twilight בְּמִדְבַּ֣ר <WH4057> bə·miḏ·bar in the Wilderness סִינָ֑י <WH5514> sî·nāy of Sinai, כְּ֠כֹל <WH3605> kə·ḵōl everything אֲשֶׁ֨ר <WH834> ’ă·šer just as צִוָּ֤ה <WH6680> ṣiw·wāh had commanded יְהוָה֙ <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - מֹשֶׁ֔ה <WH4872> mō·šeh Moses. כֵּ֥ן <WH3651> kên ... עָשׂ֖וּ <WH6213> ‘ā·śū did בְּנֵ֥י <WH1121> bə·nê The Israelites יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl ...

וַיְהִ֣י <WH1961> way·hî But there were אֲנָשִׁ֗ים <WH582> ’ă·nā·šîm some men אֲשֶׁ֨ר <WH834> ’ă·šer who הָי֤וּ <WH1961> hā·yū were טְמֵאִים֙ <WH2931> ṭə·mê·’îm unclean לְנֶ֣פֶשׁ <WH5315> lə·ne·p̄eš ..., אָדָ֔ם <WH120> ’ā·ḏām due to a dead body וְלֹא־ <WH3808> wə·lō- not יָכְל֥וּ <WH3201> yā·ḵə·lū so they could לַעֲשֹׂת־ <WH6213> la·‘ă·śōṯ- observe הַפֶּ֖סַח <WH6453> hap·pe·saḥ the Passover בַּיּ֣וֹם <WH3117> bay·yō·wm day. הַה֑וּא <WH1931> ha·hū on that וַֽיִּקְרְב֞וּ <WH7126> way·yiq·rə·ḇū And they came לִפְנֵ֥י <WH6440> lip̄·nê before מֹשֶׁ֛ה <WH4872> mō·šeh Moses וְלִפְנֵ֥י <WH6440> wə·lip̄·nê ... אַהֲרֹ֖ן <WH175> ’a·hă·rōn and Aaron בַּיּ֥וֹם <WH3117> bay·yō·wm day הַהֽוּא׃ <WH1931> ha·hū that same

וַ֠יֹּאמְרוּ <WH559> way·yō·mə·rū and said הָאֲנָשִׁ֤ים <WH582> hā·’ă·nā·šîm ... הָהֵ֙מָּה֙ <WH1992> hā·hêm·māh ... אֵלָ֔יו <WH413> ’ê·lāw to [Moses], אֲנַ֥חְנוּ <WH587> ’ă·naḥ·nū “ We טְמֵאִ֖ים <WH2931> ṭə·mê·’îm are unclean לְנֶ֣פֶשׁ <WH5315> lə·ne·p̄eš ..., אָדָ֑ם <WH120> ’ā·ḏām because of a dead body לָ֣מָּה <WH4100> lām·māh but why נִגָּרַ֗ע <WH1639> nig·gā·ra‘ should we be excluded לְבִלְתִּ֨י <WH1115> lə·ḇil·tî from הַקְרִ֜ב <WH7126> haq·riḇ presenting אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - קָרְבַּ֤ן <WH7133> qā·rə·ban offering יְהוָה֙ <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD’s בְּמֹ֣עֲד֔וֹ <WH4150> bə·mō·‘ă·ḏōw at the appointed time? ” בְּת֖וֹךְ <WH8432> bə·ṯō·wḵ with בְּנֵ֥י <WH1121> bə·nê the other Israelites יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl ...

וַיֹּ֥אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer replied אֲלֵהֶ֖ם <WH413> ’ă·lê·hem -. מֹשֶׁ֑ה <WH4872> mō·šeh Moses עִמְד֣וּ <WH5975> ‘im·ḏū “ Wait here וְאֶשְׁמְעָ֔ה <WH8085> wə·’eš·mə·‘āh until I find out מַה־ <WH4100> mah- what יְצַוֶּ֥ה <WH6680> yə·ṣaw·weh commands יְהוָ֖ה <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD לָכֶֽם׃פ Prep│2mp ( lā·ḵem) concerning you, ”
וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר <WH1696> way·ḏab·bêr said יְהוָ֖ה <WH3068> Yah·weh Then the LORD אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to מֹשֶׁ֥ה <WH4872> mō·šeh Moses לֵּאמֹֽר׃ <WH559> lê·mōr -,

דַּבֵּ֛ר <WH1696> dab·bêr “ Tell אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- ... בְּנֵ֥י <WH1121> bə·nê the Israelites יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl ...: לֵאמֹ֑ר <WH559> lê·mōr ... אִ֣ישׁ <WH376> ’îš any one אִ֣ישׁ <WH376> ’îš ... כִּי־ <WH3588> kî- ‘ When יִהְיֶֽה־ <WH1961> yih·yeh- is טָמֵ֣א׀ <WH2931> ṭā·mê unclean לָנֶ֡פֶשׁ <WH5315> lā·ne·p̄eš because of a dead body, אוֹ֩ <WH176> ’ōw of you or בְדֶ֨רֶךְ <WH1870> ḇə·ḏe·reḵ on a journey, רְחֹקָ֜הׄ <WH7350> rə·ḥō·qå̄h is away לָכֶ֗ם Prep│2mp ( lā·ḵem) א֚וֹ 176 Conj ( ’ōw) or לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם 1755 Prep-l│N-mpc│2mp ( lə·ḏō·rō·ṯê·ḵem) your descendants וְעָ֥שָׂה 6213 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConjPerf-3ms ( wə·‘ā·śāh) he may still observe פֶ֖סַח 6453 N-ms ( p̄e·saḥ) the Passover לַיהוָֽה׃ 3068 Prep-l│N-proper-ms ( Yah·weh) to the LORD.

בַּחֹ֨דֶשׁ <WH2320> ba·ḥō·ḏeš month. הַשֵּׁנִ֜י <WH8145> haš·šê·nî of the second בְּאַרְבָּעָ֨ה <WH702> bə·’ar·bā·‘āh on the fourteenth עָשָׂ֥ר <WH6240> ‘ā·śār ... י֛וֹם <WH3117> yō·wm day בֵּ֥ין <WH996> bên at הָעַרְבַּ֖יִם <WH6153> hā·‘ar·ba·yim twilight יַעֲשׂ֣וּ <WH6213> ya·‘ă·śū Such people are to observe אֹת֑וֹ <WH853> ’ō·ṯōw it עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- together with מַצּ֥וֹת <WH4682> maṣ·ṣō·wṯ unleavened bread וּמְרֹרִ֖ים <WH4844> ū·mə·rō·rîm and bitter herbs; יֹאכְלֻֽהוּ׃ <WH398> yō·ḵə·lu·hū They are to eat [the lamb],

לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- they may not יַשְׁאִ֤ירוּ <WH7604> yaš·’î·rū leave מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ <WH4480> mim·men·nū any of עַד־ <WH5704> ‘aḏ- it until בֹּ֔קֶר <WH1242> bō·qer morning וְעֶ֖צֶם <WH6106> wə·‘e·ṣem bones. לֹ֣א <WH3808> lō ... יִשְׁבְּרוּ־ <WH7665> yiš·bə·rū- or break ב֑וֹ Prep│3ms ( ḇōw) any of its כְּכָל־ 3605 Prep-k│N-msc ( kə·ḵāl-) according to all חֻקַּ֥ת 2708 N-fsc ( ḥuq·qaṯ) its statutes. הַפֶּ֖סַח 6453 Art│N-ms ( hap·pe·saḥ) the Passover יַעֲשׂ֥וּ 6213 V-Qal-Imperf-3mp ( ya·‘ă·śū) They must observe אֹתֽוֹ׃ 853 DirObjM│3ms ( ’ō·ṯōw) -

וְהָאִישׁ֩ <WH376> wə·hā·’îš But [if] a man אֲשֶׁר־ <WH834> ’ă·šer- who ה֨וּא <WH1931> hū is טָה֜וֹר <WH2889> ṭā·hō·wr ceremonially clean וּבְדֶ֣רֶךְ <WH1870> ū·ḇə·ḏe·reḵ on a journey לֹא־ <WH3808> lō- not הָיָ֗ה <WH1961> hā·yāh [and] is וְחָדַל֙ <WH2308> wə·ḥā·ḏal still fails לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת <WH6213> la·‘ă·śō·wṯ to observe הַפֶּ֔סַח <WH6453> hap·pe·saḥ the Passover, וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה <WH3772> wə·niḵ·rə·ṯāh he must be cut off הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ <WH5315> han·ne·p̄eš ... הַהִ֖וא <WH1931> ha·hi·w ... מֵֽעַמֶּ֑יהָ <WH5971> mê·‘am·me·hā from his people, כִּ֣י׀ <WH3588> kî because קָרְבַּ֣ן <WH7133> qā·rə·ban offering יְהוָ֗ה <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD’s לֹ֤א <WH3808> lō he did not הִקְרִיב֙ <WH7126> hiq·rîḇ present בְּמֹ֣עֲד֔וֹ <WH4150> bə·mō·‘ă·ḏōw at its appointed time. חֶטְא֥וֹ <WH2399> ḥeṭ·’ōw the consequences of his sin. יִשָּׂ֖א <WH5375> yiś·śā will bear הָאִ֥ישׁ <WH376> hā·’îš man הַהֽוּא׃ <WH1931> ha·hū That

וְכִֽי־ <WH3588> wə·ḵî- If יָג֨וּר <WH1481> yā·ḡūr dwelling אִתְּכֶ֜ם <WH854> ’it·tə·ḵem among you גֵּ֗ר <WH1616> gêr a foreigner וְעָ֤שָֽׂה <WH6213> wə·‘ā·śāh wants to observe פֶ֙סַח֙ <WH6453> p̄e·saḥ the Passover לַֽיהוָ֔ה <WH3068> Yah·weh to the LORD, כְּחֻקַּ֥ת <WH2708> kə·ḥuq·qaṯ statute הַפֶּ֛סַח <WH6453> hap·pe·saḥ according to the Passover וּכְמִשְׁפָּט֖וֹ <WH4941> ū·ḵə·miš·pā·ṭōw and its ordinances. כֵּ֣ן <WH3651> kên so יַעֲשֶׂ֑ה <WH6213> ya·‘ă·śeh he is to do חֻקָּ֤ה <WH2708> ḥuq·qāh statute אַחַת֙ <WH259> ’a·ḥaṯ the same יִהְיֶ֣ה <WH1961> yih·yeh You are to apply לָכֶ֔ם Prep│2mp ( lā·ḵem) וְלַגֵּ֖ר 1616 Conj-w, Prep-l, Art│N-ms ( wə·lag·gêr) to both the foreigner וּלְאֶזְרַ֥ח 249 Conj-w, Prep-l│N-msc ( ū·lə·’ez·raḥ) and the native הָאָֽרֶץ׃פ 776 Art│N-fs ( hā·’ā·reṣ) of the land. ’”

( The Cloud above the Tabernacle) ( 20 40:34-38 ) וּבְיוֹם֙ <WH3117> ū·ḇə·yō·wm On the day that הָקִ֣ים <WH6965> hā·qîm was set up, אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן <WH4908> ham·miš·kān the tabernacle, כִּסָּ֤ה <WH3680> kis·sāh covered הֶֽעָנָן֙ <WH6051> he·‘ā·nān the cloud אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן <WH4908> ham·miš·kān [it] לְאֹ֖הֶל <WH168> lə·’ō·hel the Tent הָעֵדֻ֑ת <WH5715> hā·‘ê·ḏuṯ of the Testimony, וּבָעֶ֜רֶב <WH6153> ū·ḇā·‘e·reḇ from evening יִהְיֶ֧ה <WH1961> yih·yeh ... עַֽל־ <WH5921> ‘al- above הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן <WH4908> ham·miš·kān the tabernacle כְּמַרְאֵה־ <WH4758> kə·mar·’êh- and appeared אֵ֖שׁ <WH784> ’êš like fire עַד־ <WH5704> ‘aḏ- until בֹּֽקֶר׃ <WH1242> bō·qer morning.
